title: [K-12] Enhancing Mathematical Problem-Solving Competencies Through Informal Online Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge in linear algebra, calculus, and experience with programming languages (e.g., Python)
context.additional_context: Learners autonomously explore nonlinear mathematical problems in a VR simulation environment, with a collaborative and knowledge-sharing setup using personal devices.

learning_goals: Learners can explain nonlinear equation modeling processes with 80% accuracy using VR-based simulation tools.
Learners can improve problem-solving strategies by performing peer assessments and feedback exchanges three or more times via an online collaboration platform.
Learners can curate and apply five or more optimized math resources for personalized learning paths using a tag-based content system.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
